AIN-C). With regard to receiving iron and vitamin A supplementation, differences of 36.1 
ppt (65.6% AIN-C, 29.5% non-AIN-C) and 6.8 ppt (94.3% AIN-C, 87.5% non-AIN-C) 
respectively, were reported for children. Mean height-for-age was lower in the AIN-C 
group as compared to non-participants at less than six months of age. At 6–11 months 
and 12–23 months of age, there was no difference between AIN-C children and non-
participants, suggesting a protective effect of AIN-C
